value.0:
DESCRIPTION:
Sunstone is a feldspar gem, closely related to moonstone. Sunstone can be colorless or faintly yellowish and of facet grade, but most common by far is its softer (cabochon) variety. This yields gemstones that have bright red or orange spangles (minute crystals) suspended in a nearly colorless background in a parallel fashion, giving the whole a rich golden or redish brown color
LORE:
Old legends say that only the bravest enter a tomb without one of these since the sight of a sunstone is said to cause undead much pain. 
Many clerics have storys on how a sunstone exploded into bright sunlight upon entering the land of the undead and in that saving the life of the owner.
